page.title: 09LLANDYSUL FIRE STATION
page.content: The station was built in 1964 and is maintained by 13 part-time fire-men. It has one fire engine which carries 400 gallons of water. The men practice each Thursday evening during which they get a series of drills and lectures about fire fighting. They are called to man the fire engine by a bleeper system. The main types of fires they are called to are at hay barns, farm buildings, or domestic chimney fires. They recieve{Â£6}per fire they attend and{Â£5}per Practice. The minimum number of men required on the engine before it can go out on call is 6. A fire-man has to retire at 55. The station covers an area of 7 miles radius and has won several inter-station competitions. Its closure would mean relying on the Carmarthen Brigade which is 15 miles away.
